text:
Outlook 2016 does not seem to respect text line-height in emails created with the DnD email editor. Looks like the DnD email template sets a line-height of 1.4 on all headers (h1, h2, h3 etc.) and 1.75 on all other elements, and the user cannot override these values in the text editor. So I'm assuming it's a problem for everyone.
Ping <@U24DCSJBE>
We rolled out a fix for this relatively recently, it should just work across all email clients out of the box. Any chance you can DM me a link to the email you're testing <@U4W2EG8RY>?
Yep, sending you in a minute :slightly_smiling_face:
Correction: You _can_ actually override the line height in the text editor, but this issue was observed with the default line heights.
Correction on the above, the fixes to the line height issues in Outlook are still being rolled out, but should be out to all portals soon.
